Step by step calibration

Introduction

If a user has special difficulties following the target, it may be desirable to pause the calibration process until the user has managed to focus on the right point of the screen. This is exacly how the step by step calibration works. The target will move to the next calibration point and will wait there until the user resumes the process. The system will not collect any calibration data while it is waiting.

In this tutorial, the two possible ways to perform a step-by-step calibration are explained:

  • Using default GUIs included in the API.
  • Using developers GUIs.

For more information about the calibration process, please, check out the Simple Calibration (using the API default GUIs) and Advanced Calibration (using custom GUIs) pages.

Enable/disable the calibration GUI

First, the developer will need to enable (true) or disable (false) the calibration GUI included in the API.

showCalibrationGUI(true);

And then the developer must set to true the step by step calibration as follows:

setStepByStepCalibration(true);

Using the API default GUIs

The calibration GUIs included in the API have implemented the resume action when the target is stopped and one of the following buttons is pressed:

  • The space key.
  • The mouse button anywhere but in the closing button located in the top right corner of the screen.

If these buttons are pressed when the target is travelling, it will have no effect, the process will be paused anyway when the target arrives to the calibration point.

Using your own GUIs

Once the calibration process is launched, the developer will need to call the following function of the API:

resumeCalibration();

If this function has been called once the target has arrived to the new calibration point, the system will start collecting data and the calibration process will continue by executing a callback with the new target position.

Notes

Our system ignores the resume calls in the travelling state so we can make sure the calibration pauses even if the user has accidentally pressed the space or mouse button.

We strongly recommend developers to add the mouse pressed action because of tablet users.
